historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising; since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and recent avg U is higher (0.12) with slight instability in A after tweaks, revert U toward the best while keeping the current strong agency-driving params to stabilize and potentially push A closer to 1.0.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=+0.0035) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and make a small stabilizing tweak to reduce C decay without disrupting the proven high-A regime.

Agency is already well above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) while C and D are slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the negative dC/dt and dD/dt by minimally reducing k_C_decay and k_D_decay to stabilize the substrate without perturbing the high-A regime seen near the best record.

A is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0040) while D is starting to slip, so keep U at the proven best (0.10) and make a small stabilizing nudge to prevent diversity collapse without disrupting the high-agency regime seen near the best-record params.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and currently rising (dA/dt=+0.0036) while Complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the small C drift by minimally reducing k_C_decay without disturbing the high-D regime (history shows larger multi-param shifts can hurt A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0), and since the best record occurred at U=0.10 with similar params, I’ll keep U steady and make a small calculated reduction to k_A_decay to better sustain near-max A without destabilizing C/D (recent k_A_decay tweaks showed mixed but sometimes positive effects).

A is already >0.75 and rising but C and D are drifting down, so keep U at the best-record 0.10 and apply a small stabilization tweak (lower k_C_decay, slightly raise k_CD, and slightly reduce k_D_decay) to arrest C/D collapse without disrupting the proven high-A regime.

Agency is already at 1.0 but drifting down slightly (dA/dt=-0.0005) while complexity is decaying (dC/dt=-0.0037), so keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and counter the fade by reducing A-decay and slightly reducing C-decay to stabilize C→A support without harming high diversity (history shows lowering k_A_decay previously improved A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and near-best (A=0.9990) with the same U as the best record, but C is decaying (dC/dt=-0.0056), so I’ll keep U at 0.10 while slightly reducing k_C_decay to stabilize complexity without risking the small A gains seen after recent k_C_decay tuning (e.g., Gen 4104/4178).

A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt=-0.0004), so to stabilize near-peak agency without disrupting the best-known regime (U=0.10), I’ll keep U fixed and reduce k_A_decay slightly (a lever that previously improved A at Gen 3933.8 and 4140.0).

name: Decayo-Tuned Agency Sprinter
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by finely balancing self-decay and coupling: low k_A_decay (0.0005) preserved agency gains while moderate k_CD/k_AC (0.5/0.5) kept complexity and agency mutually reinforcing. Its emergence trajectory shows repeated sensitivity to decay tuning—agency rose after reductions/retuning of k_C_decay and k_A_decay (gens 4104, 4139, 4178, 4250) and fell when those same decay knobs were pushed the wrong way (gens 3977, 4028, 4213, 4281), indicating a narrow but exploitable stability corridor under low environmental difficulty (U=0.10) rather than a difficulty-spike survival strategy.
